definition[0]: someone who is trained to give medical care and treatment to sick animals
definition[2]: to check someone’s past activities, relationships etc in order to make sure that person is suitable for a particular job, especially an important one
example[1]: All candidates are carefully vetted by Central Office.
definition[3]: to check a report, speech etc carefully to make sure it is acceptable
example[2]: The author vets every script for the new TV series.
definition[4]: to examine someone’s previous jobs and activities to find out whether they are suitable to do a job, especially one that involves dealing with secret information
example[3]: The key requirement is to vet people for the most senior posts.
example[4]: After passing the selection board, candidates are vetted by one of the organization’s professionals.
